intro: Seseli tenderiense, commonly known as the tenderiense sesame, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing adaptability to arid conditions. Its leaves are finely divided, and it produces small, dry fruits that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native range.
